column4: can someone help me with a solution for gnome locking up on startup?
can someone help me with a solution for gnome locking up on startup?
why is my "gnome" locking up at startup?
can someone help me with a solution for gnome locking up on startup?
what seems to be the problem?
at what point does it hang?
you can try sudo mv ~/.gnome ~/.gnome.bak, this will move your settings to another file and start up with a clean fresh one
you can try what i told you, sometimes it helps with those issues
remember that after doing sudo mv ~/,gnome ~/.gnome.bak you can restore it renaming gnome.bak to .gnome
yes, you dont reboot, just press ctrl + alt + backspace to restart X-server
sudo is to make superuser actions
basically what your doing is moving your gnome settings file for this session to a backup file momentarely to start fresh over
try this in your home dir:  ls -a | grep ".gnome*"
